<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUB STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; TOP:.4EX">
	2
</SUB>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	emissions&#148;.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; TEXT-INDENT:-2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	1. Product Quality
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda will strive to improve its product quality by
	verification within each development, purchasing, production, sales and service department, along with integrated verification through coordination among those departments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	26
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage30"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D194487D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; TEXT-INDENT:-2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	2. Research and Development
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda will continue to be innovative in advanced technology
	and products, aiming to create and introduce new value-added products to quickly respond to specific needs in various markets around the world, in addition to its efforts to develop the most effective safety and environmental technologies, which
	includes the spread of electric-powered motor technology. Honda will also continue its efforts to conduct research on experimental technologies for the future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; TEXT-INDENT:-2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	3. Production Efficiency
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda will strengthen its production systems at its global production bases and supply high-quality products flexibly and efficiently,
	with the aim of meeting the needs of its customers in each region. In addition, Honda will work to reduce the environmental burden of its production bases while establishing production technologies to promote the global spread of electric-powered
	motor technology. Honda will work at improving its global supply chain by devising more effective business continuity plans in order to respond to various risks including but not limited to natural disasters.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; TEXT-INDENT:-2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	4. Sales Efficiency
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda will remain proactive in its efforts to expand product
	lines and the innovative use of IT to demonstrate its continued commitment to meeting the needs of different customers throughout the world by upgrading its sales and service structure.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; TEXT-INDENT:-2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	5. Safety Technologies
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda is working to develop safety technologies that enhance
	accident prediction and prevention, technologies to help reduce the risk of injuries to passengers and pedestrians from car accidents as well as technologies that enhance compatibility between large and small vehicles. Honda will also expand its
	lineup of products incorporating such technologies. In addition, Honda will promote research and development to commercialize automated driving. Honda will reinforce and continue to advance its contribution to traffic safety in Japan and motorized
	societies abroad. Honda also intends to remain active in a variety of traffic safety programs, including advanced driving and motorcycling training programs provided by local dealerships.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; TEXT-INDENT:-2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	6. The Environment
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda will step up its efforts to
	create better, cleaner and more fuel-efficient engine technologies and to further improve recyclables throughout its product lines as well as further promote the development of fuel cells. With the long-term goal of reducing total CO
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUB STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; TOP:.4EX">
	2
</SUB>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	emissions by 50% compared to year 2000 levels by 2050, Honda has set an
	interim target to reduce CO
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUB STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; TOP:.4EX">
	2
</SUB>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	emissions from its global
	products by 30% by 2020. Honda will strengthen its efforts to realize reductions in CO
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUB STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; TOP:.4EX">
	2
</SUB>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	emissions through its entire corporate activities including its supply chain. Furthermore, Honda will strengthen its efforts in advancing technologies in the area of total energy management, to reduce
	CO
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUB STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; TOP:.4EX">
	2
</SUB>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	emissions related to mobility and people&#146;s everyday
	lives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%; TEXT-INDENT:-2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	7. Continuing to Enhance
	Honda&#146;s Social Reputation and Communication with the Community
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In addition to continuing to provide products incorporating Honda&#146;s advanced safety and environmental technologies, Honda will continue striving to enhance its social reputation by, among other
	things, strengthening its corporate governance, compliance and risk management as well as participating in community activities and making philanthropic contributions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Through these company-wide activities, Honda will strive to
	be a company that its shareholders, investors, customers and society want it to exist.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	27
</FONT>
</P>

</A>
	C. Organizational Structure
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of March 31, 2016, the Company had 89 Japanese
	subsidiaries and 279 overseas subsidiaries. The following table sets out for each of the Company&#146;s principal subsidiaries, the country of incorporation, function and percentage ownership and voting interest held by Honda.
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In addition to its
	manufacturing facilities, the Company&#146;s properties in Japan include sales offices and other sales facilities in major cities, repair service facilities, and R&amp;D facilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	29
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage33"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D194487D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of March 31, 2016, the Company&#146;s property, with a net book value of approximately
	&yen;67.7 billion, was subject to specific mortgages securing indebtedness.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Capital Expenditures
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Capital expenditures in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 were applied to the introduction of new models, as well as the improvement, streamlining and modernization of production facilities, and
	improvement of sales and R&amp;D facilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Total capital expenditures for the year amounted to &yen;2,615.0 billion, increased by &yen;280.0 billion from the previous year. Also,
	total capital expenditures, excluding equipment on operating leases, for the year amounted to &yen;647.4 billion, decreased by &yen;6.3 billion from the previous year. Spending by business segment is shown below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Intangible assets are not
	included in the table above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In Motorcycle
	business, we made capital expenditures of &yen;59,229 million in the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2016. Funds were allocated to the introduction of new models, as well as the improvement, streamlining and modernization of production facilities,
	and improvement of sales and R&amp;D facilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In Automobile business, we made capital expenditures of &yen;571,796 million in the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2016. Funds were
	allocated to the introduction of new models, as well as the improvement, streamlining and modernization of production facilities, and improvement of sales and R&amp;D facilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In Financial services business, capital expenditures
	excluding equipment on operating leases amounted to &yen;719 million in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, while capital expenditures for equipment on operating leases were &yen;1,967,538 million. Capital expenditures in Power products and other
	businesses in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, totaling &yen;15,754 million, were deployed to upgrade, streamline, and modernize manufacturing facilities for power products, and to improve R&amp;D facilities for power products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Plans after fiscal year 2016
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our management mainly considers economic trends of each
	region, demand trends, situation of competitors and our business strategy such as introduction plans of new models in determining the future of projects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	30

<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

</H5>
</EFX_UNRESOLVED_STAFF_COMMENTS>
<EFX_OPERATING_AND_FINANCIAL_REVIEW>
<A NAME="FIS_OPERATING_AND_FINANCIAL_REVIEW"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
<A NAME="D194487D20F_HTM_TOC194487_15">
</A>
	Item 5. Operating and Financial Review and Prospects
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	You should read the following discussion of our critical
	accounting policies and our financial positions and operating results together with our consolidated financial statements included in this Annual Report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
<A NAME="D194487D20F_HTM_TOC194487_16">
</A>
	A. Operating Results
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Overview
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Business Environment
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	With respect to the economic environment, the United States&#146; economy continued to recover, mainly due to an improving jobs market, a
	gradual increase in housing starts, and growing personal consumption. Europe saw a gradual economic recovery, mainly due to improvement in employment conditions and personal consumption. In the Asian economies, India experienced a moderate recovery,
	China&#146;s economy slowed gradually, Indonesia experienced a slight slowing, and Thailand&#146;s economy slowed down. The Japanese economy continued on a gradual recovery track, mainly due to an improvement trend in employment conditions and an
	upturn in capital investment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The trends,
	uncertainties, demands, commitments and events identified below may continue or recur, impacting the Company&#146;s future financial results.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Overview of Fiscal Year 2016 Operating Performance
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda&#146;s consolidated sales revenue for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 increased from the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, due
	mainly to increased sales revenue in Automobile business and Financial Services Business operations. Operating profit decreased from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to an increase in selling, general and administrative expenses including
	product warranty expenses as well as negative foreign currency effects, which was partially offset by an increase in profit attributable to increased sales revenue and model mix as well as continuing cost reduction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Motorcycle Business
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda&#146;s consolidated unit sales of motorcycles and
	all-terrain vehicles (ATVs) in fiscal year 2016 totaled 10,572 thousand units, a decrease of 1.4% from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to a decline in Brazil which more than offset increases primarily in Vietnam and the Philippines.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Automobile Business
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda&#146;s consolidated unit sales of automobiles totaled
	3,636 thousand units in fiscal year 2016, an increase of 3.5% from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to increases in sales in North America and Asia following the launch of new models and full-model-changes. On the other hand, sales primarily
	declined in Japan as a result of difficult market conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Power Product and Other Businesses
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda&#146;s consolidated unit sales of power products in fiscal year 2016 totaled 5,965 thousand units, a decrease of 0.3% from the
	previous fiscal year primarily due to a decrease in sales in Europe which more than offset an increase in North America and other countries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Fiscal Year 2016 Compared with Fiscal Year 2015
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Sales Revenue
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda&#146;s consolidated sales revenue for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, increased by &yen;1,273.0 billion, or 9.6%, to
	&yen;14,601.1 billion from the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, due mainly to increased sales revenue in the Automobile business and Financial services business operations. Honda estimates that by applying Japanese
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	32
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D194487D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	yen exchange rates of the previous fiscal year to the current fiscal year, sales revenue for the year would have increased by approximately &yen;853.9 billion, or 6.4%, compared to the increase
	as reported of &yen;1,273.0 billion, which includes positive foreign currency translation effects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Operating Costs and Expenses
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating costs and expenses increased by &yen;1,440.2 billion, or 11.4%, to &yen;14,097.7 billion from the previous fiscal year. Cost of sales increased by &yen;1,001.6 billion, or 9.7%, to &yen;11,332.3
	billion from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to an increase in costs attributable to increased consolidated unit sales in the Automobile business. Selling, general and administrative expenses increased by &yen;388.3 billion, or 22.6%, to
	&yen;2,108.8 billion from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to increased product warranty expenses. Product warranty expenses include expenses related to airbag inflators. Research and development expenses increased by &yen;50.3 billion, or 8.3%,
	to &yen;656.5 billion from the previous fiscal year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Operating
	Profit
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating profit decreased by
	&yen;167.2 billion, or 24.9%, to &yen;503.3 billion from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to an increase in selling, general and administrative expenses including product warranty expenses and negative foreign currency effects, which was
	partially offset by an increase in profit attributable to increased sales revenue and model mix as well as continuing cost reduction. Honda estimates that by excluding negative foreign currency effects of approximately &yen;60.1 billion, operating
	profit would have decreased by approximately &yen;107.0 billion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	With respect to the discussion above of the changes, management identified factors and used what it believes to be a reasonable method to analyze the respective changes in such factors. Management
	analyzed changes in these factors at the levels of the Company and its material consolidated subsidiaries. &#147;Foreign currency effects&#148; consist of &#147;translation adjustments&#148;, which come from the translation of the currency of
	foreign subsidiaries&#146; financial statements into Japanese yen, and &#147;foreign currency adjustments&#148;, which result from foreign-currency-denominated sales. With respect to &#147;foreign currency adjustments&#148;, management analyzed
	foreign currency adjustments primarily related to the following currencies: U.S. dollar, Japanese yen and others at the level of the Company and its material consolidated subsidiaries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Profit before Income Taxes
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Profit before income taxes decreased by &yen;170.7 billion, or 21.2%, to &yen;635.4 billion. The main factors behind this decrease, except
	factors relating to operating profit, are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Share of profit of investments accounted for using the equity method had a positive impact of &yen;29.9 billion, due mainly to an increase in profit attributable to increased sales revenue at affiliates
	and joint ventures in Asia, which was partially offset by a recognition of impairment loss on certain investments accounted for using the equity method.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Finance income and finance costs had a negative impact of &yen;33.4 billion, due mainly to a decrease in gains on foreign exchange. For
	further details, see note &#147;(22) Finance Income and Finance Costs&#148; to the accompanying consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Income Tax Expense
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Income tax expense decreased by &yen;16.0 billion, or 6.5%, to &yen;229.0 billion from the previous fiscal year. The average effective tax
	rate increased 5.7 percentage points to 36.1% from the previous fiscal year. For further details, see &#147;(a) Income Tax Expense&#148; of note &#147;(23) Income Taxes&#148; to the accompanying consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	33
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage37"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D194487D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Profit for the Year
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Profit for the year decreased by &yen;154.7 billion, or
	27.6%, to &yen;406.3 billion from the previous fiscal year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Profit for the Year Attributable to Owners of the Parent
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Profit for the year attributable to owners of the parent decreased by &yen;164.9 billion, or 32.4%, to &yen;344.5&nbsp;billion from the
	previous fiscal year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Profit for the Year Attributable to
	Non-controlling Interests
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Profit for the
	year attributable to non-controlling interests increased by &yen;10.1 billion, or 19.7%, to &yen;61.8&nbsp;billion from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to an increase in profit for the year of the subsidiaries in Asia which have non-controlling
	interests.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Business Segments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Motorcycle Business
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda&#146;s consolidated unit sales of motorcycles and
	all-terrain vehicles (ATVs) totaled 10,572 thousand units, decreased by 1.4% from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to a decrease in consolidated unit sales in Other Regions, which was partially offset by increase in Asia.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sales revenue from external customers decreased by &yen;41.2
	billion, or 2.2%, to &yen;1,805.4 billion from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to negative foreign currency translation effects. The impact of price changes was immaterial on sales revenue. Honda estimates that by applying Japanese yen exchange
	rates of the previous fiscal year to the current fiscal year, sales revenue for the year would have increased by approximately &yen;13.1 billion, or 0.7%, compared to the decrease as reported of &yen;41.2 billion, which includes negative foreign
	currency translation effects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating costs and
	expenses decreased by &yen;30.8 billion, or 1.9%, to &yen;1,623.6 billion from the previous fiscal year. Cost of sales decreased by &yen;30.3 billion, or 2.3%, to &yen;1,312.4 billion, due mainly to a decrease in costs attributable to decreased
	consolidated unit sales and positive foreign currency effects. Selling, general and administrative expenses decreased by &yen;9.3 billion, or 4.0%, to &yen;224.5 billion, due mainly to positive foreign currency effects. Research and development
	expenses increased by &yen;8.8 billion, or 11.4%, to &yen;86.6 billion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating profit decreased by &yen;10.3 billion, or 5.4%, to &yen;181.7 billion from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to negative foreign currency effects, which was partially offset by continuing
	cost reduction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Japan
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Total industry demand for motorcycles
	in Japan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	decreased by around 6% from the previous fiscal
	year to approximately 390 thousand units in fiscal year 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda&#146;s consolidated unit sales in Japan declined 9.5% from the previous fiscal year to 180 thousand units in fiscal year 2016, reflecting an overall decline in unit sales of scooter models, despite
	an increase in unit sales of the
<I>
	Tact
</I>
	50cc scooter and certain other models.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;

	Total demand for motorcycles and all-terrain vehicles (ATVs) in the United States
</FONT>

</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	, the principal market within North America, increased around 2% from
	the previous year to approximately 720 thousand units in calendar year 2015.

</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda&#146;s consolidated unit sales in North America increased 7.7% from the previous
	fiscal year to 308&nbsp;thousand units in fiscal year 2016. This was mainly due to a sales increase of side-by-side (SxS) models, centered on the new
<I>
	Pioneer 1000
</I>
	, and motorcycles, primarily in the United States.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">

</SUP>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Europe
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Total demand for motorcycles in Europe
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	increased around 9% from the previous year to approximately 810&nbsp;thousand units in calendar year 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda&#146;s consolidated unit sales in Europe increased 6.8%
	from the previous fiscal year to 204 thousand units in fiscal year 2016, mostly as a result of robust sales of commuter models and the launch of the new
<I>
	CRF1000L Africa Twin
</I>
	model.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*
</SUP>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Based on Honda research. Only includes the following 10 countries: the United Kingdom, Germany, France, Italy, Spain, Switzerland, Portugal, the
	Netherlands, Belgium and Austria.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Asia
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Total demand for
	motorcycles in Asia
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	decreased around 6% from the previous
	year to approximately 39,140&nbsp;thousand units in calendar year 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Looking at market conditions by country, in calendar year 2015, demand in India increased about 1% from the previous year to approximately 16,120 thousand units. Demand in China decreased around 14% from
	the previous year to approximately 9,200 thousand units. Demand in Indonesia decreased around 18% from the previous year to approximately 6,480 thousand units. Vietnam saw demand increase around 5% from the previous year to approximately 2,840
	thousand units. Demand in Thailand declined around 1% from the previous year to approximately 1,670 thousand units. Demand in Pakistan increased around 16% from the previous year to approximately 1,520 thousand units.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda&#146;s consolidated unit sales in Asia increased 2.0%
	from the previous fiscal year to 8,650 thousand units in fiscal year 2016. This was due in part to brisk sales of scooter models such as the
<I>
	Vision
</I>
	scooter in Vietnam, increased sales of the
<I>
	TMX125 Alpha
</I>
	model in the Philippines, as
	well as other factors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda&#146;s consolidated
	unit sales do not include sales by P.T. Astra Honda Motor in Indonesia, which is a joint venture accounted for using the equity method. P.T. Astra Honda Motor&#146;s unit sales for fiscal year 2016 decreased around 9% from the previous fiscal year
	to approximately 4,450 thousand units due mainly to lackluster overall market conditions, despite steady sales of the
<I>
	Vario
</I>
	series and other models.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*
</SUP>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Based on Honda research. Only includes the following eight countries: Thailand, Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Vietnam, India, Pakistan and
	China.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Other Regions
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Total demand for motorcycles in
	Brazil
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	, the principal market within Other Regions,
	declined about 17% from the previous year to approximately 1,190 thousand units in calendar year 2015, mainly due to an increase in unemployment and stricter lending standards for retail loans amid a continued worsening of economic conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In Other Regions (including South America, the
	Middle East, Africa, Oceania and other areas), Honda&#146;s consolidated unit sales decreased 21.7% from the previous fiscal year to 1,230 thousand units in fiscal year 2016, mainly reflecting an overall market slump in Brazil.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*
</SUP>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Source: ABRACICLO (the Brazilian Association of Motorcycle, Moped, and Bicycle Manufacturers)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	35
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage39"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D194487D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Automobile Business
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda&#146;s consolidated unit sales of automobiles totaled
	3,636 thousand units, increased by 3.5% from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to an increase in consolidated unit sales in North America and Asia, which was partially offset by a decrease in Japan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sales revenue from external customers increased by
	&yen;1,022.0 billion, or 10.6%, to &yen;10,625.4 billion from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to increased consolidated unit sales. The impact of price changes was immaterial on sales revenue. Honda estimates that by applying Japanese yen
	exchange rates of the previous fiscal year to the current fiscal year, sales revenue for the year would have increased by approximately &yen;682.7 billion, or 7.1%, compared to the increase as reported of &yen;1,022.0 billion, which includes
	positive foreign currency translation effects. Sales revenue including intersegment sales increased by &yen;1,009.8 billion, or 10.3%, to &yen;10,767.6 billion from the previous fiscal year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating costs and expenses increased by &yen;1,136.2 billion, or 12.0%, to &yen;10,614.3 billion from the
	previous fiscal year. Cost of sales increased by &yen;708.6 billion, or 9.3%, to &yen;8,350.5 billion, due mainly to an increase in costs attributable to increased consolidated unit sales and negative foreign currency effects. Selling, general and
	administrative expenses increased by &yen;385.9 billion, or 28.9%, to &yen;1,723.7 billion, due mainly to increased product warranty expenses. Product warranty expenses include expenses related to airbag inflators. Research and development expenses
	increased by &yen;41.5 billion, or 8.3%, to &yen;539.9 billion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating profit decreased by &yen;126.3 billion, or 45.2%, to &yen;153.3 billion from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to increased selling, general and administrative expenses including product
	warranty expenses and negative foreign currency effect, which was partially offset by an increase in profit attributable to increased sales revenue and model mix as well as continuing cost reduction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Proportion of retail unit sales by vehicle category:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Although there are various
	factors that affect the profitability of each vehicle category, sales price is an important factor in determining profitability. In general, the weighted average sales price in the light trucks category is higher relative to the total average sales
	price, while the weighted average sales price in the mini vehicles category, which is unique to the Japanese market, is relatively lower, although sales price varies from model to model.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In general, the contribution margin of the light trucks category tends to be higher relative to the total
	weighted average contribution margin because the sales price is higher, while the contribution margin of the mini vehicles category tends to be relatively lower because the sales price is lower, although the level of contribution margin varies from
	model to model. For example, in Japan and the United States, which are the main sales
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	36
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage40"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D194487D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	markets for our automobiles, the contribution margin of our light trucks category was approximately 35% higher, our passenger cars category was approximately 15% lower and our mini vehicles
	category was approximately 60% lower than total weighted average contribution margin for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016. It should be noted that we define contribution margin as an amount per unit of net sales minus material cost, which is
	thought to increase in almost direct proportion to net sales volume.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Japan
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Total demand for automobiles in Japan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*1
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	decreased around 7% from the previous fiscal year to approximately 4,930 thousand units in fiscal year 2016. This was greatly influenced by the impact of a tax increase on mini vehicles.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda&#146;s consolidated unit sales in
	Japan decreased 11.8% from the previous fiscal year to 614 thousand units
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*2
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	in fiscal year 2016. The main reason for the decline was a tax increase on mini vehicles. This was despite the positive effect from the introduction of new automobile models such as the
<I>
	Shuttle
</I>
	,
	and a full-model-change of the
<I>
	Step WGN
</I>
	, and other factors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda&#146;s unit production of automobiles in fiscal year 2016 decreased 12.3% from the previous fiscal year to 761 thousand units. This was mainly due to the negative effect of a decline in unit sales
	in Japan, which more than offset an increase in export volume.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*1
</SUP>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Source: JAMA (Japan Automobile Manufacturers Association), as measured by the number of regular vehicle registrations (661cc or higher) and mini
	vehicles (660cc or lower)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*2
</SUP>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Certain sales of automobiles that are financed with residual value type auto loans by our Japanese finance subsidiaries and sold through our
	consolidated subsidiaries are accounted for as operating leases in conformity with IFRS and are not included in consolidated sales revenue to external customers in the Automobile business. Accordingly, they are not included in consolidated unit
	sales.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	North America
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Total industry demand for automobiles
	in the United States
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	, the principal market within North
	America, rose around 6% from the previous year to approximately 17,470 thousand units in calendar year 2015. This was mainly attributable to a continued recovery in economic conditions, including the positive effects of an improvement in employment
	conditions, a gradual rise in housing starts, and a continued increase in personal consumption, as well as a surge in light truck sales as a result of lower gasoline prices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Under these conditions, Honda&#146;s consolidated unit sales
	in North America increased 10.2% from the previous fiscal year to 1,929 thousand units in fiscal year 2016. This increase was mainly attributable to the effect of launching the new
<I>
	HR-V
</I>
	model, and brisk sales of the
<I>
	CR-V
</I>
	and
<I>
	Civic
</I>
	models.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda manufactured 1,919
	thousand units in fiscal year 2016, an increase of 6.0% from the previous fiscal year. This increase mainly reflected an increase in unit production at Honda&#146;s plants in the United States and Canada, primarily to cope with brisk sales of
<I>
	CR-V
</I>
	and
<I>
	Civic
</I>
	models, and increased production of
<I>
	HR-V
</I>
	models at the plant in Mexico.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*
</SUP>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Source: Autodata
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Europe
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Total demand for automobiles in Europe
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	increased about 9% from the previous year to approximately 14,200 thousand units in calendar year 2015, mainly driven
	by the gradual recovery in economic conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	37
</FONT>

<A NAME="eolPage41"></A>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda&#146;s consolidated unit sales in Europe increased 6.8% from the previous fiscal year
	to 172 thousand units in fiscal year 2016. This was mainly due to the positive effect of launching the new
<I>
	HR-V
</I>
	model.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Unit production at Honda&#146;s U.K. plant in fiscal year 2016 was roughly level with the previous fiscal year at 115 thousand units.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">

</SUP>
	&nbsp;

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

	registrations cover 28 EU countries and three EFTA countries.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Asia
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Total demand for automobiles in Asia increased around 3% from the previous year to approximately 7,090&nbsp;thousand units
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*1
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	in calendar year 2015. This was mainly due to a recovery in demand in India despite a moderate slowdown in Indonesia.
	Total demand for automobiles in China increased about 5% from the previous calendar year to approximately 24,590 thousand units
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*2
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda&#146;s consolidated unit sales in Asia outside Japan increased 5.2% from the previous fiscal year to 670&nbsp;thousand units in
	fiscal year 2016. This increase was mainly attributable to brisk sales of the
<I>
	HR-V
</I>
	in Malaysia and Indonesia, the launch of the new
<I>
	Mobilio
</I>
	model in the Philippines, and the effect of launching the new
<I>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	BR-V
</FONT>
</I>
	&nbsp;model in Indonesia.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda&#146;s consolidated unit sales do not include unit sales of Dongfeng Honda Automobile Co., Ltd. and Guangqi Honda Automobile Co., Ltd., both of which are joint ventures accounted for using the
	equity method in China. Unit sales in China increased 33.5% from the previous fiscal year to 1,053 thousand units in fiscal year 2016. The increase was mainly attributable to strong sales of the
<I>
	XR-V
</I>
	and
<I>
	Vezel
</I>
	models.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda&#146;s unit production by
	consolidated subsidiaries in Asia increased 3.0% from the previous fiscal year to 718 thousand units
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*3
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	in fiscal year 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Meanwhile, unit production by Chinese joint ventures Dongfeng Honda Automobile Co., Ltd. and Guangqi Honda Automobile Co., Ltd. increased 29.5% from the previous fiscal year to 1,049 thousand units in
	fiscal year 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	and Pakistan.

</FONT>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Other Regions
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Total industry demand for automobiles
	in Brazil
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	, the principal market within Other Regions,
	decreased around 26% from the previous year to approximately 2,480 thousand units in calendar year 2015. The decrease resulted mainly from a deterioration in the unemployment rate and an increase in loan interest rates amid continued difficult
	economic conditions and a downturn due to the termination of the tax reduction program for manufactured products (IPI (Imposto Sobre Produtos Industrializados)).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In Other Regions (including South America, the Middle East,
	Africa, Oceania and other areas), Honda&#146;s consolidated unit sales decreased 6.7% from the previous fiscal year to 251 thousand units in fiscal year 2016. This result was due to a decrease in sales mainly in the Middle East, which was more than
	offset brisk sales of the
<I>
	HR-V
</I>
	model in Brazil and other factors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

<A NAME="eolPage42"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D194487D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Unit production at Honda&#146;s plant in Brazil increased 7.5% from the previous fiscal year
	to 144 thousand units in fiscal year 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	*
</SUP>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Source: ANFAVEA (Associa&ccedil;&atilde;o Nacional dos Fabricantes de Veiculos Automotores (the Brazilian Automobile Association)) Includes passenger
	cars and light commercial vehicles.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Financial Services Business
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	To support the sale of its products, Honda provides retail lending and leasing to customers and wholesale financing to dealers through its
	finance subsidiaries in Japan, the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, Germany, Brazil, Thailand.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Total amount of receivables from financial services and equipment on operating leases of finance subsidiaries on March 31, 2016 decreased
	by &yen;332.7 billion, or 3.7%, to &yen;8,686.1 billion from the March 31, 2015. Honda estimates that by applying Japanese yen exchange rates of the previous fiscal year to the current fiscal year, total amount of receivables from financial services
	and equipment on operating leases of finance subsidiaries as of March 31, 2016 would have increased by approximately &yen;236.0 billion, or 2.6%, compared to the decrease as reported of &yen;332.7 billion, which includes negative foreign currency
	translation effects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sales revenue from external
	customers increased by &yen;280.0 billion, or 18.0%, to &yen;1,835.6 billion from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to an increase in operating lease revenues and revenues on disposition of lease vehicles. Honda estimates that by applying
	Japanese yen exchange rates of the previous fiscal year to the current fiscal year, sales revenue for the year would have increased by approximately &yen;151.1 billion, or 9.7%, compared to the increase as reported of &yen;280.0 billion, which
	includes positive foreign currency translation effects. Sales revenue including intersegment sales increased by &yen;281.7 billion, or 18.0%, to &yen;1,849.7 billion from the previous fiscal year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating costs and expenses increased by &yen;285.0 billion,
	or 20.9%, to &yen;1,650.3 billion from the previous fiscal year. Cost of sales increased by &yen;275.2 billion, or 21.6%, to &yen;1,547.1 billion from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to an increase in costs attributable to increased operating
	lease revenues and revenues on disposition of lease vehicles. Selling, general and administrative expenses increased by &yen;9.7 billion, or 10.4%, to &yen;103.1&nbsp;billion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating profit decreased by &yen;3.2 billion, or 1.6%, to
	&yen;199.3 billion from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to increased selling, general and administrative expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Power Product and Other Businesses
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-6PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda&#146;s consolidated unit sales of power products totaled 5,965 thousand units, decreased by 0.3% from the previous fiscal year, due
	mainly to an decrease in consolidated unit sales in Europe, which was partially offset by an increase in North America.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sales revenue from external customers increased by &yen;12.1 billion, or 3.8%, to &yen;334.7 billion from the previous fiscal year, due
	mainly to increased sales revenue in Other businesses. Honda estimates that by applying Japanese yen exchange rates of the previous fiscal year to the current fiscal year, sales revenue for the year would have increased by approximately &yen;6.8
	billion, or 2.1%, compared to the increase as reported of &yen;12.1 billion, which includes positive foreign currency translation effects. Sales revenue including intersegment sales increased by &yen;5.3 billion, or 1.5%, to &yen;352.2 billion from
	the previous fiscal year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating costs and
	expenses increased by &yen;32.5 billion, or 9.3%, to &yen;383.3 billion from the previous fiscal year. Cost of sales increased by &yen;30.6 billion, or 11.5%, to &yen;296.0 billion, due mainly to an increase in operating costs in Other businesses.
	Selling, general and administrative expenses increased by &yen;1.9 billion, or 3.6%, to &yen;57.4 billion. Research and development expenses totaled to &yen;29.8 billion basically unchanged from the previous fiscal year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	39
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating loss was &yen;31.1 billion, an increase of &yen;27.2 billion from the previous
	fiscal year, due mainly to an increase in operating costs in Other businesses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Honda&#146;s consolidated unit sales in
	power product business operations in Japan increased 7.4% from the previous fiscal year to 363 thousand units in fiscal year 2016. This was mainly due to an increase in sales of OEM
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	engines, which more than offset a decline in sales of snow blowers and other models.

	increased 3.9% from the previous fiscal year to 2,811&nbsp;thousand units in fiscal year 2016. This was mainly attributable to an increase in sales of generators, lawn mowers, and OEM engines.

	In Japan, sales revenue from domestic and export sales was &yen;3,928.5 billion basically unchanged from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to an increase in sales revenue in the Financial services
	business, which was partially offset by a decrease in sales revenue in the Automobile business. Operating loss was &yen;98.7 billion, a decrease in operating profit of &yen;308.8 billion from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to increased
	selling, general and administrative expenses including product warranty expenses and a decrease in profit attributable to decreased sales revenue and model mix, which was partially offset by positive foreign currency effects.

	increased by &yen;29.3 billion, or 16.2%, to

	&yen;210.8 billion from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to an increase in profit attributable to increased sales revenue and model mix, which was partially offset by increased selling,
	general and administrative expenses including product warranty expenses and negative foreign currency effects.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In Europe, sales revenue increased by &yen;52.1 billion, or 7.2%, to &yen;776.0 billion from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to an increase in sales revenue in the Automobile business. Operating
	profit was &yen;18.7 billion, an increase of &yen;41.3 billion from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to an increase in profit attributable to increased sales revenue and model mix, which was partially offset by increased selling, general and
	administrative expenses and negative foreign currency effects.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In Asia, sales revenue increased by &yen;206.8 billion, or 6.2%, to &yen;3,535.3 billion from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to an
	increase in sales revenue in the Automobile business and Motorcycle business. Operating profit increased by &yen;56.6 billion, or 20.3%, to &yen;335.5 billion from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to continuing cost reduction, increased profit
	attributable to increased sales revenue and model mix and positive foreign currency effects, which was partially offset by increased selling, general and administrative expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In Other Regions, sales revenue decreased by &yen;141.6
	billion, or 14.9%, to &yen;808.6 billion from the previous fiscal year, due mainly to a decrease in sales revenue in the Motorcycle business. Operating loss was &yen;8.3 billion, a decrease of &yen;48.4 billion from the previous fiscal year, due
	mainly to increased selling, general and administrative expenses and negative foreign currency effects, which was partially offset by continuing cost reduction.
</FONT>
</P>
